text: The 2nd Kazakhstan President Cup was played from April 26 to April 30, 2009 in Almaty. 8 youth teams participated in the tournament (players were born no earlier than 1993.) == Participants == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !width=200| Team !width=30| Group !width=15| Result !width=80| Participation in a tournament !width=60| In a row !width=100| Last participation !width=150| The best result |- | Abdysh-Ata || A||6th|| 1|| 1|| debut|| debut |- | Academy || A||8th|| 1|| 1|| debut|| debut |- | ADO Den Haag|| B||4th|| 2|| 2|| 2008|| 6th (2008) |- | CSKA || A||2nd|| 2|| 2|| 2008|| 2nd (2008) |- | Rubin || B||7th|| 1|| 1|| debut|| debut |- | Ole Brasil|| B||Winner|| 2|| 2|| 2008|| 3rd (2008) |- | Semey-93|| B||5th|| 1|| 1|| debut|| debut |- | Spartak|| А||3rd || 2|| 2|| 2008|| 3rd (2008) |} == Venues == The match of opening and the final took place at the Central Stadium. Other matches took place at Football Land. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !colspan="4" align="center"| Almaty |- |Central Stadium |- |Attendance: 23 804 |- | 250px !rowspan=8 colspan=2| |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !colspan="4" align="center"| Almaty |- |Football Land |- |Attendance: 1 000 |- | !rowspan=8 colspan=2| |} == Format == The tournament is held in two stages. At the first stage, eight teams are divided into two qualification groups (A and B). Competitions of the first stage were held on circular system. The winners of the groups advance to the final, while the group runners-up meet to determine third place. ==Group stage== All times UTC+6 ===Group A=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !width=175|Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align="left"| CSKA |3||2||1||0||11||4||+7||7 |- |align="left"| Spartak |3||1||1||1||15||9||+6||4 |- |align="left"| Abdysh-Ata |3||1||0||2||1||13||−12||3 |- |align="left"| Academy |3||0||2||1||7||8||−1||2 |} \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Group B=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !width=175|Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align="left"| Ole Brasil |3||1||2||0||7||3||+4||5 |- |align="left"| ADO Den Haag |3||1||1||1||3||3||0||4 |- |align="left"| Semey-93 |3||1||1||1||2||2||0||4 |- |align="left"| Rubin |3||1||0||2||3||8||−5||3 |} \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- == Match for the 7th place == == Match for the 5th place == == Bronze medal match == == Final == == Statistics == === Awards === * The best player of a tournament Andre Fernandez (Ole Brasil) * Goalscorer of a tournament Aleksandr Kozlov (Spartak;14 goals) * The best goalkeeper of a tournament Sergei Panchin (Rubin) * The best defender of a tournament Jordi Pronk (ADO Den Haag) * The best midfielder of a tournament Serder Serderov (CSKA) * The best forward of a tournament Aleksandr Kozlov (Spartak) === Prize money === According to FFK, the prize fund of a tournament will make 20,000 $. "The teams which took 1, 2 and 3 place will be received, respectively 10,000, 6,000 and 4,000 $. 2009 Category:2009 in Kazakhstani football Category:2008–09 in European football Category:2009 in Asian football Category:2009 in youth association football
title: 2009 Kazakhstan President Cup (football)
